document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Caucasocressa from the eastern Pontic Region (Gastropoda: Hygromiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Caucasocressa from the eastern Pontic Region (Gastropoda: Hygromiidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Caucasocressa callosa Hausdorf and Falkner, 2001: 47
, pl. 6, figure 4. Type locality: ‘Vil. Artvin : above Demirkent , dry grassland,
2000–2300 m
alt., GF32’, Turkey .

Shell (figure 3). Depressed conical; with 5.75 convex whorls; teleoconch with strong, wrinkled growth ridges; whitish, with a brownish band below the periphery and one above the periphery; body whorl rounded; aperture almost circular; upper insertion of the peristome usually slightly descending; peristome more or less sharp, not expanded, with a strong whitish internal rib with a callous thickening at the basal side; umbilicus moderately wide, taking about 15% of the shell breadth.

caption.paragraph:
F. 1.
Caucasocressa phasiana
, sp. n. , V. Erzurum: 17 km SE of Horasan (holotype NNM). Genitalia. at, genital atrium; bc, bursa copulatrix; ep, epiphallus; fl, flagellum; o, free oviduct; p, penis; rp, penial retractor; spo, spermoviduct; v, vagina; vd, vas deferens. Scale bar=2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Caucasocressa callosa
is characterized by the small, conical shell with a callous lip. Moreover, it differs from the neighbouring
C. schmalzi
in the narrower umbilicus. The genitalia of
C. callosa
are unknown.

Distribution and material (figure 2).
Caucasocressa callosa
is known only from the mountains near Demirkent.

Turkey : V
.
Artvin : above Demirkent , dry grassland,
2000–2300 m
alt., GF32 ( holotype ZMH 2884 ; paratypes ZMH 2885 ; FAL )
.
